name: Grapefruit
description: Grapefruit is a large, round citrus fruit with a yellow-orange rind and juicy, acidic flesh that can range from white to pink to ruby red. Known for its tart to semi-sweet flavor and high vitamin C content.

name: Lemons
description: Lemons are a bright yellow citrus fruit known for their sour taste and high vitamin C content. They are commonly used in cooking, baking, and beverages.

name: Limes
description: Limes are small, green citrus fruits with a tart and acidic flavor. They are often used in beverages, cooking, and as a garnish.

name: Mandarins (inc clementines & similar hybrids)
description: Mandarins are small, sweet citrus fruits that are easy to peel. They include varieties like clementines and tangerines.

name: Oranges
description: Oranges are round, orange-colored citrus fruits known for their sweet and tangy flavor. They are a rich source of vitamin C.

name: Pomelos
description: Pomelos are the largest citrus fruit, with a thick rind and sweet, mild flavor. They are often eaten fresh or used in salads.

name: Other citrus fruits
description: This category includes other varieties of citrus fruits not specifically listed, such as kumquats, yuzu, and bergamot.

name: Almonds including ground almonds
description: Almonds are a popular tree nut known for their crunchy texture and nutty flavor. They are often consumed raw, roasted, or ground into almond flour.

name: Apricot kernels
description: Apricot kernels are the seeds found inside apricot pits. They have a bitter taste and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.

name: Brazil nuts
description: Brazil nuts are large, nutrient-rich nuts native to the Amazon rainforest. They are known for their high selenium content.

name: Cashew nuts
description: Cashew nuts are kidney-shaped nuts with a creamy texture and mild flavor. They are often used in cooking, baking, and as a snack.

name: Chestnuts
description: Chestnuts are starchy nuts with a sweet, nutty flavor. They are often roasted and used in both sweet and savory dishes.

name: Coconut - fresh
description: Fresh coconut is the white, fleshy part of the coconut fruit. It has a sweet, nutty flavor and is often eaten raw or used in cooking.

name: Coconut - desiccated, dried, flour
description: Desiccated coconut is dried and shredded coconut meat, often used in baking and cooking. Coconut flour is a gluten-free alternative to wheat flour.

name: Coconut juice, milk, cream or water
description: Coconut water is the clear liquid inside young coconuts, while coconut milk and cream are made from the grated flesh of mature coconuts. They are used in beverages and cooking.

name: Coconut - other products (yoghurt etc.)
description: This category includes other coconut-based products such as coconut yogurt, which is a dairy-free alternative made from coconut milk.

name: Hazelnuts
description: Hazelnuts are small, round nuts with a rich, buttery flavor. They are commonly used in confectionery, baking, and as a snack.

name: Macadamia nuts
description: Macadamia nuts are creamy, buttery nuts native to Australia. They are often used in baking, cooking, and as a snack.

name: Pecans
description: Pecans are rich, buttery nuts commonly used in desserts like pecan pie. They are also eaten raw or roasted as a snack.

name: Pine nuts
description: Pine nuts are small, elongated nuts with a delicate, buttery flavor. They are often used in pesto, salads, and baking.

name: Pistachios
description: Pistachios are small, green nuts with a slightly sweet flavor. They are often eaten as a snack or used in baking and cooking.

name: Walnuts
description: Walnuts are wrinkled, brain-shaped nuts with a rich, earthy flavor. They are commonly used in baking, cooking, and as a snack.

name: Other tree nuts & mixed nuts
description: This category includes other varieties of tree nuts not specifically listed, as well as mixed nuts, which are a combination of different nuts.

name: Nut spreads and butters (except peanut)
description: Nut spreads and butters are made from ground nuts, such as almond butter or cashew butter. They are a popular alternative to peanut butter.

name: Apples - fresh or dried
description: Apples are a popular fruit with a crisp texture and sweet to tart flavor. They can be eaten fresh, dried, or used in cooking and baking.

name: Pears - fresh
description: Pears are sweet, juicy fruits with a soft, buttery texture. They are often eaten fresh or used in desserts and salads.

name: Quinces
description: Quinces are fragrant, golden-yellow fruits with a tart flavor. They are often used in jams, jellies, and desserts.

name: Medlars
description: Medlars are small, brown fruits with a unique flavor that develops after they are bletted (softened). They are often used in jams and desserts.

name: Loquats
description: Loquats are small, yellow-orange fruits with a sweet, tangy flavor. They are often eaten fresh or used in jams and desserts.

name: Other pome fruit
description: This category includes other varieties of pome fruits not specifically listed, such as Asian pears and crabapples.

name: Apricots - fresh
description: Apricots are small, orange fruits with a sweet, slightly tart flavor. They are often eaten fresh, dried, or used in cooking and baking.

name: Cherries - fresh or dried
description: Cherries are small, round fruits with a sweet or tart flavor. They can be eaten fresh, dried, or used in desserts and beverages.

name: Peaches (& similar hybrids)
description: Peaches are soft, juicy fruits with a sweet flavor and fuzzy skin. They are often eaten fresh, canned, or used in desserts.

name: Plums - fresh
description: Plums are juicy fruits with a sweet to tart flavor and smooth skin. They are often eaten fresh, dried (as prunes), or used in cooking.

name: Nectarines
description: Nectarines are smooth-skinned fruits similar to peaches, with a sweet and slightly tangy flavor. They are often eaten fresh or used in desserts.

name: Other stone fruit
description: This category includes other varieties of stone fruits not specifically listed, such as pluots and apriums.

name: Table grapes
description: Table grapes are sweet, seedless grapes typically eaten fresh as a snack or used in fruit salads and desserts.

name: Wine grapes
description: Wine grapes are specifically cultivated for winemaking, with varieties chosen for their flavor, sugar content, and acidity.

name: Strawberries - fresh or dried
description: Strawberries are bright red, juicy berries with a sweet flavor. They are eaten fresh, dried, or used in desserts and jams.

name: Blackberries
description: Blackberries are dark, juicy berries with a sweet-tart flavor. They are often eaten fresh, used in desserts, or made into jams.

name: Dewberries
description: Dewberries are similar to blackberries but smaller and slightly sweeter. They are often used in jams, pies, and desserts.

name: Loganberries, boysenberries and other hybrids
description: Loganberries and boysenberries are hybrid berries with a sweet-tart flavor. They are often used in jams, desserts, and beverages.

name: Raspberries
description: Raspberries are delicate, sweet-tart berries that are often eaten fresh, used in desserts, or made into jams and sauces.

name: Other cane fruit
description: This category includes other varieties of cane fruits not specifically listed, such as tayberries and marionberries.

name: Blueberries - fresh or dried
description: Blueberries are small, sweet berries with a deep blue color. They are often eaten fresh, dried, or used in baking and smoothies.

name: Cranberries - fresh or dried
description: Cranberries are tart, red berries often used in sauces, juices, and baked goods. They are also dried and eaten as a snack.

name: Currants (black, red, white)
description: Currants are small, tart berries that come in black, red, and white varieties. They are often used in jams, jellies, and desserts.

name: Goji berries (wolfberry) - fresh or dried
description: Goji berries, also known as wolfberries, are small, red berries with a sweet-tart flavor. They are often consumed dried for their health benefits.

name: Gooseberries
description: Gooseberries are small, tart berries that come in green, red, or yellow varieties. They are often used in desserts, jams, and sauces.

name: Rosehips
description: Rosehips are the fruit of the rose plant, known for their high vitamin C content. They are often used in teas, jams, and supplements.

name: Mulberries
description: Mulberries are sweet, dark berries that grow on mulberry trees. They are often eaten fresh, dried, or used in desserts and jams.

name: Azarole (mediterranean medlar)
description: Azarole, also known as Mediterranean medlar, is a small fruit with a sweet-tart flavor. It is often used in jams and desserts.

name: Elderberries
description: Elderberries are small, dark berries with a tart flavor. They are often used in syrups, wines, and medicinal preparations.

name: Other small fruit & berries
description: This category includes other small fruits and berries not specifically listed, such as lingonberries and huckleberries.

name: Vine fruits - currants
description: Dried currants are small, tart berries often used in baking, cooking, and as a snack.

name: Vine fruits - raisins
description: Raisins are dried grapes, known for their sweet flavor and chewy texture. They are often used in baking, cooking, and as a snack.

name: Vine fruits - sultanas
description: Sultanas are a type of dried grape, similar to raisins but lighter in color and slightly sweeter. They are often used in baking and cooking.

name: Apricots - dried
description: Dried apricots are sweet, chewy fruits that are often eaten as a snack or used in baking and cooking.

name: Dates - dried
description: Dried dates are sweet, sticky fruits often eaten as a snack or used in baking and desserts.

name: Figs - dried
description: Dried figs are sweet, chewy fruits often eaten as a snack or used in baking and cooking.

name: Papaya - dried
description: Dried papaya is a sweet, chewy fruit often eaten as a snack or used in trail mixes and desserts.

name: Pears - dried
description: Dried pears are sweet, chewy fruits often eaten as a snack or used in baking and cooking.

name: Pineapple - dried
description: Dried pineapple is a sweet, tangy fruit often eaten as a snack or used in trail mixes and desserts.

name: Prunes - dried plums
description: Prunes are dried plums, known for their sweet flavor and digestive benefits. They are often eaten as a snack or used in baking.

name: Tomatoes - dried (sundried, sunblush)
description: Dried tomatoes, such as sun-dried or sun-blushed tomatoes, are often used in Mediterranean cuisine for their intense flavor.

name: Other dried or candied fruits and mixed dried fruits
description: This category includes other dried or candied fruits and mixed dried fruits, often used in baking, cooking, and as snacks.

name: Dried vegetables - various
description: Dried vegetables, such as dried carrots, onions, and peppers, are often used in soups, stews, and seasoning blends.

name: Carambola (star fruit)
description: Carambola, also known as star fruit, is a tropical fruit with a distinctive star shape when sliced. It has a sweet-tart flavor and is often eaten fresh or used in salads and desserts.

name: Dates - fresh
description: Fresh dates are sweet, chewy fruits often eaten as a snack or used in desserts and baking. They are rich in natural sugars and nutrients.

name: Dragonfruit (pitahaya)
description: Dragonfruit, also known as pitahaya, is a vibrant tropical fruit with a mild, sweet flavor. It is often eaten fresh or used in smoothies and desserts.

name: Figs - fresh
description: Fresh figs are soft, sweet fruits with a unique texture. They are often eaten fresh, used in salads, or paired with cheeses and desserts.

name: Jambolan (java plum)
description: Jambolan, also known as java plum, is a dark purple fruit with a sweet and slightly astringent flavor. It is often eaten fresh or used in jams and beverages.

name: Kumquats
description: Kumquats are small, oval citrus fruits with a sweet peel and tart flesh. They are often eaten whole, used in marmalades, or as a garnish.

name: Olives (table consumption)
description: Table olives are cured and prepared for direct consumption. They come in various flavors, from briny to sweet, and are often used in salads, tapenades, and as snacks.

name: Persimmon - fresh or dried
description: Persimmons are sweet, orange fruits with a honey-like flavor. They can be eaten fresh, dried, or used in desserts and baked goods.

name: Other misc. fruit - edible peel
description: This category includes other miscellaneous fruits with edible peels not specifically listed, such as guavas and loquats.

name: American persimmon (Virginia kaki)
description: American persimmon, also known as Virginia kaki, is a small, sweet fruit with a soft texture. It is often eaten fresh or used in desserts.

name: Kiwi fruit - fresh or dried
description: Kiwi fruit is a small, green fruit with a tangy-sweet flavor and tiny black seeds. It is often eaten fresh, used in salads, or dried as a snack.

name: Longans
description: Longans are small, round fruits with a sweet, floral flavor. They are often eaten fresh or used in desserts and beverages.

name: Litchis (lychee)
description: Litchis, also known as lychees, are small, juicy fruits with a sweet, floral flavor. They are often eaten fresh or used in desserts and beverages.

name: Passion fruit, granadilla, maracujá
description: Passion fruit, also known as granadilla or maracujá, is a tropical fruit with a tart, aromatic flavor. It is often used in juices, desserts, and sauces.

name: Prickly pear
description: Prickly pear is the fruit of the cactus plant, with a sweet, mild flavor. It is often eaten fresh or used in jams, jellies, and beverages.

name: Rambutans
description: Rambutans are small, hairy fruits with a sweet, juicy flesh. They are often eaten fresh or used in desserts and beverages.

name: Star apple
description: Star apple is a tropical fruit with a sweet, milky flesh. It is often eaten fresh or used in desserts and beverages.

name: Tamarillo
description: Tamarillo, also known as tree tomato, is a small, egg-shaped fruit with a tangy flavor. It is often used in sauces, jams, and desserts.

name: Other misc. fruit - inedible peel, small
description: This category includes other small fruits with inedible peels not specifically listed, such as mangosteens and salak.

name: Avocados
description: Avocados are creamy, nutrient-rich fruits with a mild, buttery flavor. They are often eaten fresh, used in salads, or made into guacamole.

name: Bananas & plantains
description: Bananas and plantains are starchy, sweet fruits often eaten fresh, cooked, or used in baking. Plantains are typically cooked before eating.

name: Bread fruit
description: Breadfruit is a starchy tropical fruit often used as a staple food. It can be roasted, fried, or boiled and has a texture similar to bread.

name: Cherimoya
description: Cherimoya, also known as custard apple, is a sweet, creamy fruit with a unique flavor. It is often eaten fresh or used in desserts.

name: Durian
description: Durian is a large, spiky fruit known for its strong odor and creamy, custard-like flesh. It is often eaten fresh or used in desserts.

name: Guava - fresh or dried
description: Guava is a tropical fruit with a sweet, tangy flavor. It is often eaten fresh, used in juices, or dried as a snack.

name: Mangoes - fresh or dried
description: Mangoes are sweet, juicy fruits with a rich, tropical flavor. They are often eaten fresh, used in smoothies, or dried as a snack.

name: Papaya (pawpaw)
description: Papaya, also known as pawpaw, is a tropical fruit with a sweet, musky flavor. It is often eaten fresh, used in salads, or made into juices.

name: Pineapples
description: Pineapples are tropical fruits with a sweet, tangy flavor. They are often eaten fresh, used in desserts, or made into juices.

name: Pomegranates
description: Pomegranates are large, red fruits filled with juicy, tart seeds. They are often eaten fresh, used in salads, or made into juices.

name: Soursop (guanabana)
description: Soursop, also known as guanabana, is a large, spiky fruit with a sweet, tangy flavor. It is often eaten fresh or used in beverages and desserts.

name: Other misc. fruit - inedible peel, large
description: This category includes other large fruits with inedible peels not specifically listed, such as jackfruit and breadnut.

name: Early potatoes
description: Early potatoes are harvested before they reach full maturity, resulting in a tender texture and thin skin. They are often used in salads and light cooking.

name: Ware potatoes
description: Ware potatoes are fully mature potatoes with a thicker skin and firmer texture. They are suitable for long-term storage and versatile in cooking.

name: Cassava, manioc, tapioca and products
description: Cassava, also known as manioc, is a starchy root vegetable used in various forms, including fresh, dried (tapioca), and processed products. It is a staple food in many tropical regions.

name: Dasheen, taro & eddoes
description: Dasheen, taro, and eddoes are starchy root vegetables commonly used in tropical cuisines. They are often boiled, fried, or used in stews and soups.

name: Sweet potatoes
description: Sweet potatoes are root vegetables with a sweet, orange flesh. They are often baked, mashed, or used in desserts and savory dishes.

name: Yams
description: Yams are starchy tuber vegetables with a rough, bark-like skin. They are often boiled, roasted, or used in traditional dishes in tropical regions.

name: Other tropical root & tuber vegetables
description: This category includes other tropical root and tuber vegetables not specifically listed, such as arrowroot and malanga.

name: Beetroot
description: Beetroot is a root vegetable with a deep red color and sweet, earthy flavor. It is often eaten roasted, boiled, or used in salads and juices.

name: Carrots
description: Carrots are root vegetables with a sweet, crunchy texture. They are often eaten raw, cooked, or used in soups, stews, and salads.

name: Celeriac
description: Celeriac, also known as celery root, is a knobby root vegetable with a mild, celery-like flavor. It is often used in soups, stews, and mashed dishes.

name: Chicory (root)
description: Chicory root is a bitter root vegetable often used as a coffee substitute or in herbal teas. It is also used in cooking and as a dietary supplement.

name: Jerusalem artichokes
description: Jerusalem artichokes, also known as sunchokes, are tuber vegetables with a nutty, sweet flavor. They are often roasted, sautéed, or used in soups.

name: Parsnips
description: Parsnips are root vegetables with a sweet, nutty flavor. They are often roasted, mashed, or used in soups and stews.

name: Parsley root
description: Parsley root is a root vegetable with a mild, parsley-like flavor. It is often used in soups, stews, and as a flavoring agent.

name: Radishes incl. daikon
description: Radishes, including daikon, are root vegetables with a crisp texture and peppery flavor. They are often eaten raw, pickled, or used in salads and soups.

name: Salsify
description: Salsify, also known as oyster plant, is a root vegetable with a mild, oyster-like flavor. It is often boiled, mashed, or used in soups.

name: Swedes and rutabaga
description: Swedes and rutabaga are root vegetables with a sweet, earthy flavor. They are often roasted, mashed, or used in stews and casseroles.

name: Turnips
description: Turnips are root vegetables with a slightly bitter, peppery flavor. They are often roasted, boiled, or used in soups and stews.

name: Other temperate root & tuber vegetables
description: This category includes other temperate root and tuber vegetables not specifically listed, such as horseradish and skirret.

name: Garlic, fresh, powder and paste
description: Garlic is a pungent bulb vegetable used fresh, as a powder, or in paste form. It is a key ingredient in many cuisines for its strong, savory flavor.

name: Onions
description: Onions are bulb vegetables with a sharp, pungent flavor. They are used in a wide variety of dishes, both raw and cooked.

name: Shallots
description: Shallots are small, mild-flavored bulb vegetables often used in gourmet cooking. They are similar to onions but with a sweeter, more delicate flavor.

name: Spring onions, Welsh onions, scallions
description: Spring onions, Welsh onions, and scallions are mild-flavored bulb vegetables often used as garnishes or in salads, soups, and stir-fries.

name: Other bulb vegetables
description: This category includes other bulb vegetables not specifically listed, such as leeks and chives.

name: Aubergines (egg plant, brinjal)
description: Aubergines, also known as eggplants or brinjals, are versatile vegetables with a spongy texture and mild flavor. They are often used in dishes like ratatouille, curries, and grilled preparations.

name: Pepinos
description: Pepinos are sweet, melon-like fruits with a mild, cucumber-like flavor. They are often eaten fresh or used in fruit salads and desserts.

name: Peppers (sweet or bell) - fresh or dried
description: Sweet or bell peppers are colorful, mild-flavored vegetables often used in salads, stir-fries, and stuffed dishes. They can be eaten fresh or dried.

name: Chilli peppers - fresh or dried
description: Chilli peppers are spicy vegetables used to add heat and flavor to dishes. They can be used fresh, dried, or ground into powders and sauces.

name: Tomatoes
description: Tomatoes are juicy, flavorful fruits often used as vegetables in cooking. They are used in salads, sauces, soups, and a wide variety of dishes.

name: Tomatillo (ground cherry)
description: Tomatillos, also known as ground cherries, are small, green fruits with a tart flavor. They are often used in Mexican cuisine, particularly in salsas and sauces.

name: Other solanacea
description: This category includes other members of the Solanaceae family not specifically listed, such as tamarillos and garden huckleberries.

name: Bitter melon (balsam pear)
description: Bitter melon, also known as balsam pear, is a tropical fruit with a bitter taste. It is often used in Asian cuisines for its unique flavor and health benefits.

name: Courgettes, zucchini, summer squash
description: Courgettes, zucchini, and summer squash are mild-flavored, versatile vegetables often used in salads, stir-fries, and baked dishes.

name: Cucumbers
description: Cucumbers are crisp, refreshing vegetables often eaten raw in salads, sandwiches, or as a snack. They are also used in pickling.

name: Gherkins
description: Gherkins are small, pickled cucumbers with a tangy flavor. They are often used as a condiment or snack.

name: Mexican squash (choyote or christophine)
description: Mexican squash, also known as chayote or christophine, is a mild-flavored vegetable often used in soups, stews, and salads.

name: Other cucurbits-edible peel
description: This category includes other cucurbit vegetables with edible peels not specifically listed, such as pattypan squash and luffa.

name: Melons, cantaloupes
description: Melons, including cantaloupes, are sweet, juicy fruits often eaten fresh or used in fruit salads and desserts.

name: Pumpkins & squashes (winter squash, marrows)
description: Pumpkins and winter squashes are hearty, flavorful vegetables often used in soups, stews, and baked dishes. Marrows are a type of summer squash.

name: Watermelons
description: Watermelons are large, juicy fruits with a sweet, refreshing flavor. They are often eaten fresh or used in fruit salads and beverages.

name: Other cucurbits-inedible peel
description: This category includes other cucurbit vegetables with inedible peels not specifically listed, such as bottle gourds and snake gourds.

name: Okra (bhindi, gumbo, ladies fingers)
description: Okra, also known as bhindi or ladies fingers, is a green, pod-like vegetable often used in stews, soups, and fried dishes. It has a unique, slightly slimy texture.

name: Sweetcorn and baby corn
description: Sweetcorn and baby corn are sweet, tender vegetables often eaten fresh, boiled, or grilled. Baby corn is commonly used in stir-fries and salads.

name: Broccoli, calabrese
description: Broccoli and calabrese are green, nutrient-rich vegetables with a mild, slightly bitter flavor. They are often steamed, roasted, or used in stir-fries.

name: Cauliflower
description: Cauliflower is a versatile vegetable with a mild, slightly nutty flavor. It is often used in dishes like cauliflower rice, roasted cauliflower, and soups.

name: Chinese broccoli/kale, kai lan, gai lan, cai ro and choi sum
description: Chinese broccoli, kale, kai lan, gai lan, cai ro, and choi sum are leafy green vegetables commonly used in Asian cuisines. They are often stir-fried or steamed.

name: Brussels sprouts
description: Brussels sprouts are small, cabbage-like vegetables with a slightly bitter flavor. They are often roasted, sautéed, or used in casseroles.

name: Other flowering brassicas
description: This category includes other flowering brassica vegetables not specifically listed, such as Romanesco broccoli and purple cauliflower.

name: Head cabbage
description: Head cabbage is a leafy vegetable with a dense, round head. It is often used in coleslaw, soups, and stir-fries.

name: Other head brassicas
description: This category includes other head brassica vegetables not specifically listed, such as savoy cabbage and red cabbage.

name: Chinese cabbage and pak choi, bok choi
description: Chinese cabbage, pak choi, and bok choi are leafy green vegetables commonly used in Asian cuisines. They are often stir-fried or used in soups.

name: Kale (includes collards)
description: Kale, including collards, is a nutrient-dense leafy green vegetable with a slightly bitter flavor. It is often used in salads, soups, and smoothies.

name: Other leafy brassicas
description: This category includes other leafy brassica vegetables not specifically listed, such as mustard greens and turnip greens.

name: Kohlrabi
description: Kohlrabi is a bulbous vegetable with a mild, slightly sweet flavor. It is often eaten raw, roasted, or used in soups and stews.

name: Cress
description: Cress is a leafy green vegetable with a peppery flavor. It is often used as a garnish, in salads, or as a microgreen.

name: Microgreens (other than cress)
description: Microgreens are young, tender greens harvested just after the first leaves have developed. They are often used as garnishes or in salads for their intense flavors and nutritional benefits.

name: Lambs lettuce (corn salad)
description: Lambs lettuce, also known as corn salad, is a tender leafy green with a mild, nutty flavor. It is often used in salads and as a garnish.

name: Land cress
description: Land cress is a leafy green vegetable with a peppery flavor similar to watercress. It is often used in salads, soups, and as a garnish.

name: Lettuce
description: Lettuce is a leafy green vegetable commonly used in salads, sandwiches, and wraps. It comes in various varieties, including romaine, iceberg, and butterhead.

name: Red mustard
description: Red mustard is a leafy green vegetable with a spicy, peppery flavor. It is often used in salads, stir-fries, and as a garnish.

name: Ruccola (rocket, arugula)
description: Ruccola, also known as rocket or arugula, is a leafy green with a peppery, slightly bitter flavor. It is often used in salads, pizzas, and as a garnish.

name: Leaves and stems of brassica
description: This category includes the leaves and stems of brassica vegetables, such as kale, collards, and mustard greens, which are often used in cooking and salads.

name: Scarole (broad-leaf endive) & frisée
description: Scarole and frisée are types of endive with slightly bitter, curly leaves. They are often used in salads and cooked dishes.

name: Other lettuce-like and salad vegetables
description: This category includes other lettuce-like and salad vegetables not specifically listed, such as mizuna and tatsoi.

name: Spinach
description: Spinach is a nutrient-rich leafy green vegetable with a mild, slightly sweet flavor. It is often used in salads, soups, and cooked dishes.

name: Beet leaves (chard)
description: Beet leaves, also known as chard, are leafy greens with a slightly bitter flavor. They are often used in salads, soups, and sautéed dishes.

name: Purslane
description: Purslane is a succulent leafy green with a slightly tangy flavor. It is often used in salads, soups, and as a garnish.

name: Other spinach-like leaf vegetables
description: This category includes other spinach-like leafy greens not specifically listed, such as amaranth and orache.

name: Vine leaves
description: Vine leaves, such as grape leaves, are often used in Mediterranean cuisine for wrapping dishes like dolmas. They have a mild, slightly tangy flavor.

name: Watercress
description: Watercress is a peppery, leafy green vegetable often used in salads, sandwiches, and as a garnish. It is also used in soups and stir-fries.

name: Ong choi (fresh water spinach)
description: Ong choi, also known as water spinach, is a leafy green vegetable commonly used in Asian cuisines. It is often stir-fried or used in soups.

name: Witloof (chicory) and forced radicchio
description: Witloof, also known as chicory, and forced radicchio are bitter leafy greens often used in salads and cooked dishes. They are known for their crisp texture.

name: Other leaf vegetables (not lettuce or spinach-like)
description: This category includes other leaf vegetables not specifically listed, such as sorrel and dandelion greens.

name: Basil
description: Basil is a fragrant herb with a sweet, slightly peppery flavor. It is often used in Italian cuisine, particularly in pesto, salads, and pasta dishes.

name: Bay leaves (sweet bay, laurel)
description: Bay leaves are aromatic leaves used to flavor soups, stews, and sauces. They are typically removed before serving.

name: Celery leaves (Chinese celery)
description: Celery leaves, including Chinese celery, are aromatic greens often used to flavor soups, stews, and stir-fries. They have a stronger flavor than celery stalks.

name: Centella (Asiatic pennywort, gotu kola)
description: Centella, also known as Asiatic pennywort or gotu kola, is a leafy herb often used in traditional medicine and Asian cuisines. It has a slightly bitter flavor.

name: Chervil
description: Chervil is a delicate herb with a mild, anise-like flavor. It is often used in French cuisine, particularly in salads, soups, and sauces.

name: Chives
description: Chives are a mild-flavored herb with a subtle onion-like taste. They are often used as a garnish or in salads, soups, and dips.

name: Coriander leaves (cilantro)
description: Coriander leaves, also known as cilantro, are a fragrant herb with a citrusy, slightly peppery flavor. They are often used in Mexican, Indian, and Asian cuisines.

name: Curry leaves (Bergera/Murraya koenigii)
description: Curry leaves are aromatic leaves used in Indian and Southeast Asian cuisines. They have a slightly bitter, nutty flavor and are often used in curries and soups.

name: Dill leaves
